about_the_game:
INTRODUCTION

Step into the role of a test subject navigating the floors of a mysterious building in "Disposition." Each level challenges your memory and observation skills, introducing new mechanics that continually reshape your approach to the game. Under the pressure of time, you must quickly adapt and strategize to optimize your placement of objects and ascend the leaderboard.

MODES (FLOORS)

In Disposition, each floor presents a distinct objective, challenging players with a new set of tasks. With 9 floors in total, here are a few examples of what to expect.

Floor 01: Echo Placement

Memorize the room carefully. Once you think you're ready, you'll be handed an object and must place it back where it belongs—no second chances. Ten correct placements are required to move forward. A single mistake, and you'll start over from the beginning. Failure is not forgiven here.

Floor 02: Snapshot

Armed with a camera, you must spot and capture anomalies in nearly identical rooms. Objects may move, increasing the challenge. Identify the disturbance in ten rooms to reach the next floor.

Floor 03: Spectacle Split

Equipped with split-screen spectacles, you must spot subtle differences in a gallery of paintings. Walk through the door numbered according to the anomalies you find. Ten correct answers in a row will allow you to proceed.

KEY FEATURES

  • Player-Directed Exploration: As a test subject, explore different levels of a building, each introducing unique gameplay elements centered around memory and observation.

  • Progressive Gameplay Mechanics: Engage with evolving challenges as each floor introduces new elements that test your ability to remember and observe under pressure.

  • Timed Challenges: Time is of the essence, requiring you to make quick, precise decisions to navigate through the levels efficiently.

  • Engaging Memory Challenges: Use your memory to strategically place objects and navigate complex environments, enhancing your gameplay experience.

  • Dynamic Object Interactions: How you interact with objects significantly affects your progress, making each decision crucial.

  • Single-Player Progression: Encounter increasingly intricate scenarios that challenge your cognitive and strategic abilities.

  • Competitive Leaderboards: Aim for the top by honing your skills and achieving faster completion times.

Join "Disposition" and influence its evolution with your feedback. Engage with a community of players dedicated to refining and expanding the gameplay experience. Your feedback is vital as we continue to expand and enrich the game's world and mechanics.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Processor: Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 from around 2016 or later
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 or AMD Radeon RX 580 or newer
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 7 from 2018 or later
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or AMD Radeon RX 6700 XT or newer
  • Storage: 3 GB available space

short_description: Disposition is an escape-room-inspired game about strategic memory placement. You go through a sequence of engaging tasks where you must detect anomalies and observe details, all while being timed. These challenges change every floor you ascend.
